function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Different building codes and systems of sustainability assessments in different countries may lead to inconsistencies and lack of standardization in pandemic-sustainable criteria for residential buildings.","Impact":"Failure to establish consistent pandemic-sustainable criteria may result in increased vulnerability of residential buildings to pandemics and hinder international scientific and industrial development.","Mitigation":"Develop a global standard for pandemic-sustainable criteria in residential buildings and encourage collaboration among different countries and certification systems.","Technologies":"Standardization platforms, international collaboration tools, and data analytics for benchmarking and comparison.","People":"Global policymakers, building code regulators, certification system organizations, researchers, and industry stakeholders.","Owner":"Global policymakers, international organizations, and industry stakeholders."},{"Description":"Lack of a complete system to measure building readiness responding to pandemics may result in incomplete or ineffective preparedness for future pandemics.","Impact":"Inadequate preparedness may lead to increased risks of disease transmission and compromised health and safety of residents in residential buildings.","Mitigation":"Develop a comprehensive system with all necessary indicators of pandemic sustainability and integrate it into global GBC&RSs.","Technologies":"Data analytics, predictive modeling, building simulation software, and public health expertise.","People":"Researchers, public health professionals, building sustainability experts, and policy makers.","Owner":"Research institutions, public health organizations, and international building sustainability associations."},{"Description":"Imbalance in pandemic response indicators among different GBC&RSs may result in limited options for residential buildings to address specific pandemic-related challenges.","Impact":"Limited options may lead to suboptimal pandemic resilience in residential buildings and hinder their ability to effectively mitigate disease propagation.","Mitigation":"Conduct a comparative analysis of GBC&RSs' pandemic response indicators and identify opportunities for cross-system collaboration and integration.","Technologies":"Data analysis tools, comparative assessment platforms, and interoperable certification system interfaces.","People":"Building sustainability experts, certification system organizations, researchers, and industry stakeholders.","Owner":"International building sustainability associations, certification system organizations, and industry stakeholders."}]}
